intro: Cryptantha granulosa, commonly known as the granular cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact, mat-forming growth habit. Its leaves are hairy and often have a granular texture, which gives it its common name. Cryptantha granulosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides.
